Optional. Specifies a user-defined name-value pair associated with the blob. If no name-value pairs are specified, the operation will copy the metadata from the source blob or file to the destination blob. If one or more name-value pairs are specified, the destination blob is created with the specified metadata, and metadata is not copied from the source blob or file. Note that beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for C# identifiers. See Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata for more information.
If specified, the operation only succeeds if the resource's lease is active and matches this ID.

Optional. Specifies the encryption key to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, encryption is performed with the root account encryption key. For more information, see Encryption at Rest for Azure Storage Services.

member.name: M:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlobRestClient.BreakLeaseAsync(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: [Update] The Lease Blob operation establishes and manages a lock on a blob for write and delete operations.
member.param: The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..

For a break operation, proposed duration the lease should continue before it is broken, in seconds, between 0 and 60. This break period is only used if it is shorter than the time remaining on the lease. If longer, the time remaining on the lease is used. A new lease will not be available before the break period has expired, but the lease may be held for longer than the break period. If this header does not appear with a break operation, a fixed-duration lease breaks after the remaining lease period elapses, and an infinite lease breaks immediately.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has not been modified since the specified date/time.

Specify a SQL where clause on blob tags to operate only on blobs with a matching value.

member.summary: The Create Snapshot operation creates a read-only snapshot of a blob.
member.param: The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..

Optional. Specifies a user-defined name-value pair associated with the blob. If no name-value pairs are specified, the operation will copy the metadata from the source blob or file to the destination blob. If one or more name-value pairs are specified, the destination blob is created with the specified metadata, and metadata is not copied from the source blob or file. Note that beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for C# identifiers. See Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata for more information.

Optional. Specifies the encryption key to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, encryption is performed with the root account encryption key. For more information, see Encryption at Rest for Azure Storage Services.
The SHA-256 hash of the provided encryption key. Must be provided if the x-ms-encryption-key header is provided.

member.name: M:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlobRestClient.SetTierAsync(Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.AccessTier,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.RehydratePriority},System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: The Set Tier operation sets the tier on a blob. The operation is allowed on a page blob in a premium storage account and on a block blob in a blob storage account (locally redundant storage only). A premium page blob's tier determines the allowed size, IOPS, and bandwidth of the blob. A block blob's tier determines Hot/Cool/Archive storage type. This operation does not update the blob's ETag.
member.param: Indicates the tier to be set on the blob.

The snapshot parameter is an opaque DateTime value that, when present, specifies the blob snapshot to retrieve. For more information on working with blob snapshots, see Creating a Snapshot of a Blob..
The version id parameter is an opaque DateTime value that, when present, specifies the version of the blob to operate on. It's for service version 2019-10-10 and newer.
The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..
Optional: Indicates the priority with which to rehydrate an archived blob.
If specified, the operation only succeeds if the resource's lease is active and matches this ID.
Specify a SQL where clause on blob tags to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
The cancellation token to use.

member.name: T:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobCorsRule
member.summary: CORS is an HTTP feature that enables a web application running under one domain to access resources in another domain. Web browsers implement a security restriction known as same-origin policy that prevents a web page from calling APIs in a different domain; CORS provides a secure way to allow one domain (the origin domain) to call APIs in another domain.
BlobCorsRule.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobCorsRule.AllowedOrigins
member.summary: The origin domains that are permitted to make a request against the storage service via CORS. The origin domain is the domain from which the request originates. Note that the origin must be an exact case-sensitive match with the origin that the user age sends to the service. You can also use the wildcard character '*' to allow all origin domains to make requests via CORS.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobCorsRule.AllowedMethods
member.summary: The methods (HTTP request verbs) that the origin domain may use for a CORS request. (comma separated).

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobCorsRule.AllowedHeaders
member.summary: the request headers that the origin domain may specify on the CORS request.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobCorsRule.ExposedHeaders
member.summary: The response headers that may be sent in the response to the CORS request and exposed by the browser to the request issuer.

member.summary: If the blob has an MD5 hash and this operation is to read the full blob, this response header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobAppendInfo.ContentCrc64
member.summary: This header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity. The value of this header is computed by the Blob service; it is not necessarily the same value specified in the request headers.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobAppendInfo.BlobAppendOffset
member.summary: This response header is returned only for append operations. It returns the offset at which the block was committed, in bytes.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobAppendInfo.BlobCommittedBlockCount
member.summary: The number of committed blocks present in the blob. This header is returned only for append blobs.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobAppendInfo.IsServerEncrypted
member.summary: The value of this header is set to true if the contents of the request are successfully encrypted using the specified algorithm, and false otherwise.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobAppendInfo.EncryptionKeySha256
member.summary: The SHA-256 hash of the encryption key used to encrypt the block. This header is only returned when the block was encrypted with a customer-provided key.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobAppendInfo.EncryptionScope
member.summary: Returns the name of the encryption scope used to encrypt the blob contents and application metadata. Note that the absence of this header implies use of the default account encryption scope.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobDownloadDetails.ContentRange
member.summary: Indicates the range of bytes returned in the event that the client requested a subset of the blob by setting the 'Range' request header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobDownloadDetails.ETag
member.summary: The ETag contains a value that you can use to perform operations conditionally. If the request version is 2011-08-18 or newer, the ETag value will be in quotes.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobDownloadDetails.ContentEncoding
member.summary: This header returns the value that was specified for the Content-Encoding request header

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobDownloadDetails.CacheControl
member.summary: This header is returned if it was previously specified for the blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobDownloadDetails.ContentDisposition
member.summary: This header returns the value that was specified for the 'x-ms-blob-content-disposition' header. The Content-Disposition response header field conveys additional information about how to process the response payload, and also can be used to attach additional metadata. For example, if set to attachment, it indicates that the user-agent should not display the response, but instead show a Save As dialog with a filename other than the blob name specified.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobDownloadDetails.ContentLanguage
member.summary: This header returns the value that was specified for the Content-Language request header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobDownloadDetails.BlobSequenceNumber
member.summary: The current sequence number for a page blob. This header is not returned for block blobs or append blobs

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobDownloadDetails.CopyCompletedOn
member.summary: Conclusion time of the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this blob was the destination blob. This value can specify the time of a completed, aborted, or failed copy attempt. This header does not appear if a copy is pending, if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobDownloadDetails.CopyStatusDescription
member.summary: Only appears when x-ms-copy-status is failed or pending. Describes the cause of the last fatal or non-fatal copy operation failure. This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobDownloadDetails.CopyId
member.summary: String identifier for this copy operation. Use with Get Blob Properties to check the status of this copy operation, or pass to Abort Copy Blob to abort a pending copy.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobDownloadDetails.CopyProgress
member.summary: Contains the number of bytes copied and the total bytes in the source in the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this blob was the destination blob. Can show between 0 and Content-Length bytes copied. This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobDownloadDetails.CopySource
member.summary: URL up to 2 KB in length that specifies the source blob or file used in the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this blob was the destination blob. This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobDownloadDetails.CopyStatus
member.summary: State of the copy operation identified by x-ms-copy-id.

This value may or may not be equal to the value returned in Content-MD5 header, with the latter calculated from the requested range

member.name: T:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobHttpHeaders
member.summary:
Standard HTTP properties supported by containers and blobs. These properties are represented as standard HTTP headers use standard names, as specified in the Header Field Definitions section 14 of the HTTP/1.1 protocol specification.
For more information, see
Setting and retrieving properties and metadata for Blob service resources.

member.summary: The MIME content type of the blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobHttpHeaders.ContentHash
member.summary: An MD5 hash of the blob content. This hash is used to verify the integrity of the blob during transport. When this header is specified, the storage service checks the hash that has arrived with the one that was sent. If the two hashes do not match, the operation will fail with error code 400 (Bad Request).

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobHttpHeaders.ContentEncoding
member.summary: Specifies which content encodings have been applied to the blob. This value is returned to the client when the Get Blob operation is performed on the blob resource. The client can use this value when returned to decode the blob content.

member.summary: Specifies the natural languages used by this resource.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobHttpHeaders.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Conveys additional information about how to process the response payload, and also can be used to attach additional metadata. For example, if set to attachment, it indicates that the user-agent should not display the response, but instead show a Save As dialog with a filename other than the blob name specified.

member.summary: The blob's type.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.CopyCompletedOn
member.summary: Conclusion time of the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this blob was the destination blob. This value can specify the time of a completed, aborted, or failed copy attempt. This header does not appear if a copy is pending, if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.CopyStatusDescription
member.summary: Only appears when x-ms-copy-status is failed or pending. Describes the cause of the last fatal or non-fatal copy operation failure. This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.CopyId
member.summary: String identifier for this copy operation. Use with Get Blob Properties to check the status of this copy operation, or pass to Abort Copy Blob to abort a pending copy.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.CopyProgress
member.summary: Contains the number of bytes copied and the total bytes in the source in the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this blob was the destination blob. Can show between 0 and Content-Length bytes copied. This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.CopySource
member.summary: URL up to 2 KB in length that specifies the source blob or file used in the last attempted Copy Blob operation where this blob was the destination blob. This header does not appear if this blob has never been the destination in a Copy Blob operation, or if this blob has been modified after a concluded Copy Blob operation using Set Blob Properties, Put Blob, or Put Block List.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.CopyStatus
member.summary: State of the copy operation identified by x-ms-copy-id.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.IsIncrementalCopy
member.summary: Included if the blob is incremental copy blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.DestinationSnapshot
member.summary: Included if the blob is incremental copy blob or incremental copy snapshot, if x-ms-copy-status is success. Snapshot time of the last successful incremental copy snapshot for this blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.LeaseDuration
member.summary: When a blob is leased, specifies whether the lease is of infinite or fixed duration.

member.summary: Lease state of the blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.LeaseStatus
member.summary: The current lease status of the blob.

member.summary: The number of bytes present in the response body.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.ContentType
member.summary: The content type specified for the blob. The default content type is 'application/octet-stream'.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.ETag
member.summary: The ETag contains a value that you can use to perform operations conditionally. If the request version is 2011-08-18 or newer, the ETag value will be in quotes.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.ContentHash
member.summary: If the blob has an MD5 hash and this operation is to read the full blob, this response header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.ContentEncoding
member.summary: This header returns the value that was specified for the Content-Encoding request header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.ContentDisposition
member.summary: This header returns the value that was specified for the 'x-ms-blob-content-disposition' header. The Content-Disposition response header field conveys additional information about how to process the response payload, and also can be used to attach additional metadata. For example, if set to attachment, it indicates that the user-agent should not display the response, but instead show a Save As dialog with a filename other than the blob name specified.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.ContentLanguage
member.summary: This header returns the value that was specified for the Content-Language request header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.CacheControl
member.summary: This header is returned if it was previously specified for the blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.BlobSequenceNumber
member.summary: The current sequence number for a page blob. This header is not returned for block blobs or append blobs.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.AcceptRanges
member.summary: Indicates that the service supports requests for partial blob content.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.BlobCommittedBlockCount
member.summary: The number of committed blocks present in the blob. This header is returned only for append blobs.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.IsServerEncrypted
member.summary: The value of this header is set to true if the blob data and application metadata are completely encrypted using the specified algorithm. Otherwise, the value is set to false (when the blob is unencrypted, or if only parts of the blob/application metadata are encrypted).

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.EncryptionKeySha256
member.summary: The SHA-256 hash of the encryption key used to encrypt the metadata. This header is only returned when the metadata was encrypted with a customer-provided key.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.EncryptionScope
member.summary: Returns the name of the encryption scope used to encrypt the blob contents and application metadata. Note that the absence of this header implies use of the default account encryption scope.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.AccessTier
member.summary: The tier of page blob on a premium storage account or tier of block blob on blob storage LRS accounts. For a list of allowed premium page blob tiers, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/windows/premium-storage#features. For blob storage LRS accounts, valid values are Hot/Cool/Archive.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.AccessTierInferred
member.summary: For page blobs on a premium storage account only. If the access tier is not explicitly set on the blob, the tier is inferred based on its content length and this header will be returned with true value.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.ArchiveStatus
member.summary: For blob storage LRS accounts, valid values are rehydrate-pending-to-hot/rehydrate-pending-to-cool. If the blob is being rehydrated and is not complete then this header is returned indicating that rehydrate is pending and also tells the destination tier.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.AccessTierChangedOn
member.summary: The time the tier was changed on the object. This is only returned if the tier on the block blob was ever set.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.VersionId
member.summary: A DateTime value returned by the service that uniquely identifies the blob. The value of this header indicates the blob version, and may be used in subsequent requests to access this version of the blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.IsLatestVersion
member.summary: The value of this header indicates whether version of this blob is a current version, see also x-ms-version-id header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobProperties.TagCount
member.summary: The number of tags associated with the blob.

member.summary: The time this blob will expire.

member.summary: This header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity. This header refers to the content of the request, meaning, in this case, the list of blocks, and not the content of the blob itself.

member.summary: This header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity. This header refers to the content of the request, meaning, in this case, the list of blocks, and not the content of the blob itself.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobCommitBlockListHeaders.Version
member.summary: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request. This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and above.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobCommitBlockListHeaders.VersionId
member.summary: A DateTime value returned by the service that uniquely identifies the blob. The value of this header indicates the blob version, and may be used in subsequent requests to access this version of the blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobCommitBlockListHeaders.IsServerEncrypted
member.summary: The value of this header is set to true if the contents of the request are successfully encrypted using the specified algorithm, and false otherwise.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobCommitBlockListHeaders.EncryptionKeySha256
member.summary: The SHA-256 hash of the encryption key used to encrypt the blob. This header is only returned when the blob was encrypted with a customer-provided key.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobCommitBlockListHeaders.EncryptionScope
member.summary: Returns the name of the encryption scope used to encrypt the blob contents and application metadata. Note that the absence of this header implies use of the default account encryption scope.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobGetBlockListHeaders.LastModified
member.summary: Returns the date and time the container was last modified. Any operation that modifies the blob, including an update of the blob's metadata or properties, changes the last-modified time of the blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobGetBlockListHeaders.ContentType
member.summary: The media type of the body of the response. For Get Block List this is 'application/xml'.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobGetBlockListHeaders.BlobContentLength
member.summary: The size of the blob in bytes.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobGetBlockListHeaders.Version
member.summary: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request. This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and above.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobPutBlobFromUrlHeaders.LastModified
member.summary: Returns the date and time the container was last modified. Any operation that modifies the blob, including an update of the blob's metadata or properties, changes the last-modified time of the blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobPutBlobFromUrlHeaders.ContentMD5
member.summary: If the blob has an MD5 hash and this operation is to read the full blob, this response header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobPutBlobFromUrlHeaders.Version
member.summary: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request. This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and above.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobPutBlobFromUrlHeaders.VersionId
member.summary: A DateTime value returned by the service that uniquely identifies the blob. The value of this header indicates the blob version, and may be used in subsequent requests to access this version of the blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobPutBlobFromUrlHeaders.IsServerEncrypted
member.summary: The value of this header is set to true if the contents of the request are successfully encrypted using the specified algorithm, and false otherwise.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobPutBlobFromUrlHeaders.EncryptionKeySha256
member.summary: The SHA-256 hash of the encryption key used to encrypt the blob. This header is only returned when the blob was encrypted with a customer-provided key.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobPutBlobFromUrlHeaders.EncryptionScope

member.name: M:Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlockBlobRestClient.#ctor(Azure.Core.Pipeline.ClientDiagnostics,Azure.Core.Pipeline.HttpPipeline,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of BlockBlobRestClient.
member.param: The handler for diagnostic messaging in the client.
The HTTP pipeline for sending and receiving REST requests and responses.
The URL of the service account, container, or blob that is the targe of the desired operation.
Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

member.summary: The Upload Block Blob operation updates the content of an existing block blob. Updating an existing block blob overwrites any existing metadata on the blob. Partial updates are not supported with Put Blob; the content of the existing blob is overwritten with the content of the new blob. To perform a partial update of the content of a block blob, use the Put Block List operation.
member.param: The length of the request.
Initial data.
The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..
Specify the transactional md5 for the body, to be validated by the service.
Optional. Sets the blob's content type. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. Sets the blob's content encoding. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. Set the blob's content language. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. An MD5 hash of the blob content. Note that this hash is not validated, as the hashes for the individual blocks were validated when each was uploaded.
Optional. Sets the blob's cache control. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.

Optional. Specifies a user-defined name-value pair associated with the blob. If no name-value pairs are specified, the operation will copy the metadata from the source blob or file to the destination blob. If one or more name-value pairs are specified, the destination blob is created with the specified metadata, and metadata is not copied from the source blob or file. Note that beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for C# identifiers. See Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata for more information.
If specified, the operation only succeeds if the resource's lease is active and matches this ID.
Optional. Sets the blob's Content-Disposition header.

Optional. Specifies the encryption key to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, encryption is performed with the root account encryption key. For more information, see Encryption at Rest for Azure Storage Services.
The SHA-256 hash of the provided encryption key. Must be provided if the x-ms-encryption-key header is provided.
The algorithm used to produce the encryption key hash. Currently, the only accepted value is "AES256". Must be provided if the x-ms-encryption-key header is provided.

Optional. Version 2019-07-07 and later. Specifies the name of the encryption scope to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, encryption is performed with the default account encryption scope. For more information, see Encryption at Rest for Azure Storage Services.
Optional. Indicates the tier to be set on the blob.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has not been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs without a matching value.
Specify a SQL where clause on blob tags to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
Optional. Used to set blob tags in various blob operations.
Specifies the date time when the blobs immutability policy is set to expire.
Specifies the immutability policy mode to set on the blob.
Specified if a legal hold should be set on the blob.
The cancellation token to use.

member.summary: The Put Blob from URL operation creates a new Block Blob where the contents of the blob are read from a given URL. This API is supported beginning with the 2020-04-08 version. Partial updates are not supported with Put Blob from URL; the content of an existing blob is overwritten with the content of the new blob. To perform partial updates to a block blob’s contents using a source URL, use the Put Block from URL API in conjunction with Put Block List.
member.param: The length of the request.

Specifies the name of the source page blob snapshot. This value is a URL of up to 2 KB in length that specifies a page blob snapshot. The value should be URL-encoded as it would appear in a request URI. The source blob must either be public or must be authenticated via a shared access signature.
The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..
Specify the transactional md5 for the body, to be validated by the service.
Optional. Sets the blob's content type. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. Sets the blob's content encoding. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. Set the blob's content language. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. An MD5 hash of the blob content. Note that this hash is not validated, as the hashes for the individual blocks were validated when each was uploaded.
Optional. Sets the blob's cache control. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.

Optional. Specifies a user-defined name-value pair associated with the blob. If no name-value pairs are specified, the operation will copy the metadata from the source blob or file to the destination blob. If one or more name-value pairs are specified, the destination blob is created with the specified metadata, and metadata is not copied from the source blob or file. Note that beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for C# identifiers. See Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata for more information.
If specified, the operation only succeeds if the resource's lease is active and matches this ID.
Optional. Sets the blob's Content-Disposition header.

Optional. Specifies the encryption key to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, encryption is performed with the root account encryption key. For more information, see Encryption at Rest for Azure Storage Services.
The SHA-256 hash of the provided encryption key. Must be provided if the x-ms-encryption-key header is provided.
The algorithm used to produce the encryption key hash. Currently, the only accepted value is "AES256". Must be provided if the x-ms-encryption-key header is provided.

Optional. Version 2019-07-07 and later. Specifies the name of the encryption scope to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, encryption is performed with the default account encryption scope. For more information, see Encryption at Rest for Azure Storage Services.
Optional. Indicates the tier to be set on the blob.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has not been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs without a matching value.
Specify a SQL where clause on blob tags to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has not been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs without a matching value.
Specify a SQL where clause on blob tags to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
Specify the md5 calculated for the range of bytes that must be read from the copy source.
Optional. Used to set blob tags in various blob operations.
Optional, default is true. Indicates if properties from the source blob should be copied.
The cancellation token to use.

member.summary: The Commit Block List operation writes a blob by specifying the list of block IDs that make up the blob. In order to be written as part of a blob, a block must have been successfully written to the server in a prior Put Block operation. You can call Put Block List to update a blob by uploading only those blocks that have changed, then committing the new and existing blocks together. You can do this by specifying whether to commit a block from the committed block list or from the uncommitted block list, or to commit the most recently uploaded version of the block, whichever list it may belong to.
member.param: The BlockLookupList to use.
The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..
Optional. Sets the blob's cache control. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. Sets the blob's content type. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. Sets the blob's content encoding. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. Set the blob's content language. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. An MD5 hash of the blob content. Note that this hash is not validated, as the hashes for the individual blocks were validated when each was uploaded.
Specify the transactional md5 for the body, to be validated by the service.
Specify the transactional crc64 for the body, to be validated by the service.

Optional. Specifies a user-defined name-value pair associated with the blob. If no name-value pairs are specified, the operation will copy the metadata from the source blob or file to the destination blob. If one or more name-value pairs are specified, the destination blob is created with the specified metadata, and metadata is not copied from the source blob or file. Note that beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for C# identifiers. See Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata for more information.
If specified, the operation only succeeds if the resource's lease is active and matches this ID.
Optional. Sets the blob's Content-Disposition header.

Optional. Specifies the encryption key to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, encryption is performed with the root account encryption key. For more information, see Encryption at Rest for Azure Storage Services.
The SHA-256 hash of the provided encryption key. Must be provided if the x-ms-encryption-key header is provided.
The algorithm used to produce the encryption key hash. Currently, the only accepted value is "AES256". Must be provided if the x-ms-encryption-key header is provided.

Optional. Version 2019-07-07 and later. Specifies the name of the encryption scope to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, encryption is performed with the default account encryption scope. For more information, see Encryption at Rest for Azure Storage Services.
Optional. Indicates the tier to be set on the blob.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has not been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs without a matching value.
Specify a SQL where clause on blob tags to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
Optional. Used to set blob tags in various blob operations.

Specifies the immutability policy mode to set on the blob.

Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs without a matching value.

Optional. Used to set blob tags in various blob operations.

member.name: M:Azure.Storage.Blobs.ContainerRestClient.CreateAsync(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Nullable{Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.PublicAccessType},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: creates a new container under the specified account. If the container with the same name already exists, the operation fails.
member.param: The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..

Optional. Specifies a user-defined name-value pair associated with the blob. If no name-value pairs are specified, the operation will copy the metadata from the source blob or file to the destination blob. If one or more name-value pairs are specified, the destination blob is created with the specified metadata, and metadata is not copied from the source blob or file. Note that beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for C# identifiers. See Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata for more information.
Specifies whether data in the container may be accessed publicly and the level of access.
Optional. Version 2019-07-07 and later. Specifies the default encryption scope to set on the container and use for all future writes.
Optional. Version 2019-07-07 and newer. If true, prevents any request from specifying a different encryption scope than the scope set on the container.
The cancellation token to use.

member.summary: [Update] establishes and manages a lock on a container for delete operations. The lock duration can be 15 to 60 seconds, or can be infinite.
member.param: The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..

Specifies the duration of the lease, in seconds, or negative one (-1) for a lease that never expires. A non-infinite lease can be between 15 and 60 seconds. A lease duration cannot be changed using renew or change.

Proposed lease ID, in a GUID string format. The Blob service returns 400 (Invalid request) if the proposed lease ID is not in the correct format. See Guid Constructor (String) for a list of valid GUID string formats.

member.name: M:Azure.Storage.Blobs.ContainerRestClient.BreakLeaseAsync(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: [Update] establishes and manages a lock on a container for delete operations. The lock duration can be 15 to 60 seconds, or can be infinite.
member.param: The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..

For a break operation, proposed duration the lease should continue before it is broken, in seconds, between 0 and 60. This break period is only used if it is shorter than the time remaining on the lease. If longer, the time remaining on the lease is used. A new lease will not be available before the break period has expired, but the lease may be held for longer than the break period. If this header does not appear with a break operation, a fixed-duration lease breaks after the remaining lease period elapses, and an infinite lease breaks immediately.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has not been modified since the specified date/time.

member.summary: [Update] The List Blobs operation returns a list of the blobs under the specified container.
member.param: Filters the results to return only containers whose name begins with the specified prefix.

A string value that identifies the portion of the list of containers to be returned with the next listing operation. The operation returns the NextMarker value within the response body if the listing operation did not return all containers remaining to be listed with the current page. The NextMarker value can be used as the value for the marker parameter in a subsequent call to request the next page of list items. The marker value is opaque to the client.

Specifies the maximum number of containers to return. If the request does not specify maxresults, or specifies a value greater than 5000, the server will return up to 5000 items. Note that if the listing operation crosses a partition boundary, then the service will return a continuation token for retrieving the remainder of the results. For this reason, it is possible that the service will return fewer results than specified by maxresults, or than the default of 5000.
Include this parameter to specify one or more datasets to include in the response.
The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..
The cancellation token to use.

member.name: M:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobRestClient.#ctor(Azure.Core.Pipeline.ClientDiagnostics,Azure.Core.Pipeline.HttpPipeline,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of PageBlobRestClient.
member.param: The handler for diagnostic messaging in the client.
The HTTP pipeline for sending and receiving REST requests and responses.
The URL of the service account, container, or blob that is the targe of the desired operation.
Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

member.summary: The Create operation creates a new page blob.
member.param: The length of the request.
This header specifies the maximum size for the page blob, up to 1 TB. The page blob size must be aligned to a 512-byte boundary.
The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..
Optional. Indicates the tier to be set on the page blob.
Optional. Sets the blob's content type. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. Sets the blob's content encoding. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. Set the blob's content language. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. An MD5 hash of the blob content. Note that this hash is not validated, as the hashes for the individual blocks were validated when each was uploaded.
Optional. Sets the blob's cache control. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.

Optional. Specifies a user-defined name-value pair associated with the blob. If no name-value pairs are specified, the operation will copy the metadata from the source blob or file to the destination blob. If one or more name-value pairs are specified, the destination blob is created with the specified metadata, and metadata is not copied from the source blob or file. Note that beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for C# identifiers. See Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata for more information.
If specified, the operation only succeeds if the resource's lease is active and matches this ID.
Optional. Sets the blob's Content-Disposition header.

Optional. Specifies the encryption key to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, encryption is performed with the root account encryption key. For more information, see Encryption at Rest for Azure Storage Services.
The SHA-256 hash of the provided encryption key. Must be provided if the x-ms-encryption-key header is provided.
The algorithm used to produce the encryption key hash. Currently, the only accepted value is "AES256". Must be provided if the x-ms-encryption-key header is provided.

Optional. Version 2019-07-07 and later. Specifies the name of the encryption scope to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, encryption is performed with the default account encryption scope. For more information, see Encryption at Rest for Azure Storage Services.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has not been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs without a matching value.
Specify a SQL where clause on blob tags to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
Set for page blobs only. The sequence number is a user-controlled value that you can use to track requests. The value of the sequence number must be between 0 and 2^63 - 1.
Optional. Used to set blob tags in various blob operations.
Specifies the date time when the blobs immutability policy is set to expire.
Specifies the immutability policy mode to set on the blob.
Specified if a legal hold should be set on the blob.
The cancellation token to use.

member.summary: The Create operation creates a new page blob.
member.param: The length of the request.
This header specifies the maximum size for the page blob, up to 1 TB. The page blob size must be aligned to a 512-byte boundary.
The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..
Optional. Indicates the tier to be set on the page blob.
Optional. Sets the blob's content type. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. Sets the blob's content encoding. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. Set the blob's content language. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.
Optional. An MD5 hash of the blob content. Note that this hash is not validated, as the hashes for the individual blocks were validated when each was uploaded.
Optional. Sets the blob's cache control. If specified, this property is stored with the blob and returned with a read request.

Optional. Specifies a user-defined name-value pair associated with the blob. If no name-value pairs are specified, the operation will copy the metadata from the source blob or file to the destination blob. If one or more name-value pairs are specified, the destination blob is created with the specified metadata, and metadata is not copied from the source blob or file. Note that beginning with version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for C# identifiers. See Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata for more information.
If specified, the operation only succeeds if the resource's lease is active and matches this ID.
Optional. Sets the blob's Content-Disposition header.

Optional. Specifies the encryption key to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, encryption is performed with the root account encryption key. For more information, see Encryption at Rest for Azure Storage Services.
The SHA-256 hash of the provided encryption key. Must be provided if the x-ms-encryption-key header is provided.
The algorithm used to produce the encryption key hash. Currently, the only accepted value is "AES256". Must be provided if the x-ms-encryption-key header is provided.

Optional. Version 2019-07-07 and later. Specifies the name of the encryption scope to use to encrypt the data provided in the request. If not specified, encryption is performed with the default account encryption scope. For more information, see Encryption at Rest for Azure Storage Services.

Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has not been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs without a matching value.
Specify a SQL where clause on blob tags to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
Set for page blobs only. The sequence number is a user-controlled value that you can use to track requests. The value of the sequence number must be between 0 and 2^63 - 1.
Optional. Used to set blob tags in various blob operations.
Specifies the date time when the blobs immutability policy is set to expire.
Specifies the immutability policy mode to set on the blob.
Specified if a legal hold should be set on the blob.

member.summary: The Get Page Ranges Diff operation returns the list of valid page ranges for a page blob that were changed between target blob and previous snapshot.
member.param: The snapshot parameter is an opaque DateTime value that, when present, specifies the blob snapshot to retrieve. For more information on working with blob snapshots, see Creating a Snapshot of a Blob..
The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..

Optional in version 2015-07-08 and newer. The prevsnapshot parameter is a DateTime value that specifies that the response will contain only pages that were changed between target blob and previous snapshot. Changed pages include both updated and cleared pages. The target blob may be a snapshot, as long as the snapshot specified by prevsnapshot is the older of the two. Note that incremental snapshots are currently supported only for blobs created on or after January 1, 2016.

Optional. This header is only supported in service versions 2019-04-19 and after and specifies the URL of a previous snapshot of the target blob. The response will only contain pages that were changed between the target blob and its previous snapshot.
Return only the bytes of the blob in the specified range.

member.name: M:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobRestClient.CopyIncrementalAsync(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: The Copy Incremental operation copies a snapshot of the source page blob to a destination page blob. The snapshot is copied such that only the differential changes between the previously copied snapshot are transferred to the destination. The copied snapshots are complete copies of the original snapshot and can be read or copied from as usual. This API is supported since REST version 2016-05-31.
member.param: Specifies the name of the source page blob snapshot. This value is a URL of up to 2 KB in length that specifies a page blob snapshot. The value should be URL-encoded as it would appear in a request URI. The source blob must either be public or must be authenticated via a shared access signature.
The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify this header value to operate only on a blob if it has not been modified since the specified date/time.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
Specify an ETag value to operate only on blobs without a matching value.
Specify a SQL where clause on blob tags to operate only on blobs with a matching value.
The cancellation token to use.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobUpdateSequenceNumberHeaders.LastModified
member.summary: Returns the date and time the container was last modified. Any operation that modifies the blob, including an update of the blob's metadata or properties, changes the last-modified time of the blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobUpdateSequenceNumberHeaders.BlobSequenceNumber
member.summary: The current sequence number for a page blob. This header is not returned for block blobs or append blobs.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobUpdateSequenceNumberHeaders.Version
member.summary: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request. This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and above.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobUploadPagesFromURLHeaders.LastModified
member.summary: Returns the date and time the container was last modified. Any operation that modifies the blob, including an update of the blob's metadata or properties, changes the last-modified time of the blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobUploadPagesFromURLHeaders.ContentMD5
member.summary: If the blob has an MD5 hash and this operation is to read the full blob, this response header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobUploadPagesFromURLHeaders.XMsContentCrc64
member.summary: This header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity. The value of this header is computed by the Blob service; it is not necessarily the same value specified in the request headers.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobUploadPagesFromURLHeaders.BlobSequenceNumber
member.summary: The current sequence number for the page blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobUploadPagesFromURLHeaders.Version

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobUploadPagesFromURLHeaders.EncryptionScope

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobUploadPagesHeaders.LastModified

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobUploadPagesHeaders.ContentMD5

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Blobs.PageBlobUploadPagesHeaders.XMsContentCrc64

member.name: M:Azure.Storage.Blobs.ServiceRestClient.ListContainersSegmentAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.ListContainersIncludeType},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: The List Containers Segment operation returns a list of the containers under the specified account.
member.param: Filters the results to return only containers whose name begins with the specified prefix.

A string value that identifies the portion of the list of containers to be returned with the next listing operation. The operation returns the NextMarker value within the response body if the listing operation did not return all containers remaining to be listed with the current page. The NextMarker value can be used as the value for the marker parameter in a subsequent call to request the next page of list items. The marker value is opaque to the client.

Specifies the maximum number of containers to return. If the request does not specify maxresults, or specifies a value greater than 5000, the server will return up to 5000 items. Note that if the listing operation crosses a partition boundary, then the service will return a continuation token for retrieving the remainder of the results. For this reason, it is possible that the service will return fewer results than specified by maxresults, or than the default of 5000.
Include this parameter to specify that the container's metadata be returned as part of the response body.
The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations..
The cancellation token to use.

member.name: T:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder
member.summary:
is used to generate a Shared Access Signature (SAS) for an Azure Storage container or blob. For more information, see
Create a service SAS.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.Version
member.summary: The storage service version to use to authenticate requests made with this shared access signature, and the service version to use when handling requests made with this shared access signature.
member.remarks: This property has been deprecated and we will always use the latest storage SAS version of the Storage service supported. This change does not have any impact on how your application generates or makes use of SAS tokens.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.Protocol
member.summary: The optional signed protocol field specifies the protocol permitted for a request made with the SAS. Possible values are , , and .

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.StartsOn
member.summary: Optionally specify the time at which the shared access signature becomes valid. If omitted when DateTimeOffset.MinValue is used, start time for this call is assumed to be the time when the storage service receives the request.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.ExpiresOn
member.summary: The time at which the shared access signature becomes invalid. This field must be omitted if it has been specified in an associated stored access policy.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.Permissions
member.summary: The permissions associated with the shared access signature. The user is restricted to operations allowed by the permissions. This field must be omitted if it has been specified in an associated stored access policy. The , , , or can be used to create the permissions string.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.IPRange
member.summary: Specifies an IP address or a range of IP addresses from which to accept requests. If the IP address from which the request originates does not match the IP address or address range specified on the SAS token, the request is not authenticated. When specifying a range of IP addresses, note that the range is inclusive.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.Identifier
member.summary: An optional unique value up to 64 characters in length that correlates to an access policy specified for the container.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.BlobContainerName
member.summary: The name of the blob container being made accessible.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.BlobName
member.summary: The name of the blob being made accessible, or for a container SAS.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.Snapshot
member.summary: The name of the snapshot being made accessible, or for a blob SAS.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.BlobVersionId
member.summary: The name of the blob version being made accessible, or for a blob SAS.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.Resource
member.summary:
Specifies which resources are accessible via the shared access signature.
Specify "b" if the shared resource is a blob. This grants access to the content and metadata of the blob.
Specify "c" if the shared resource is a blob container. This grants access to the content and metadata of any blob in the container, and to the list of blobs in the container.
Beginning in version 2018-11-09, specify "bs" if the shared resource is a blob snapshot. This grants access to the content and metadata of the specific snapshot, but not the corresponding root blob.
Beginning in version 2019-12-12, specify "bv" if the shared resource is a blob version. This grants access to the content and metadata of the specific version, but not the corresponding root blob.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.CacheControl
member.summary: Override the value returned for Cache-Control response header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Override the value returned for Content-Disposition response header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.ContentEncoding
member.summary: Override the value returned for Cache-Encoding response header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.ContentLanguage
member.summary: Override the value returned for Cache-Language response header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.ContentType
member.summary: Override the value returned for Cache-Type response header.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.PreauthorizedAgentObjectId
member.summary: Optional. Beginning in version 2020-02-10, this value will be used for the AAD Object ID of a user authorized by the owner of the User Delegation Key to perform the action granted by the SAS. The Azure Storage service will ensure that the owner of the user delegation key has the required permissions before granting access. No additional permission check for the user specified in this value will be performed. This is only used with generating User Delegation SAS.

member.name: P:Azure.Storage.Sas.BlobSasBuilder.CorrelationId
member.summary: Optional. Beginning in version 2020-02-10, this value will be used for to correlate the storage audit logs with the audit logs used by the principal generating and distributing SAS. This is only used for User Delegation SAS.

member.name: T:Azure.Storage.Cryptography.Models.KeyEnvelope
member.summary: Represents the envelope key details JSON schema stored on the service. In the envelope technique, a securely generated content encryption key (CEK) is generated for every encryption operation. It is then encrypted (wrapped) with the user-provided key encryption key (KEK), using a key-wrap algorithm. The wrapped CEK is stored with the encrypted data, and needs the KEK to be unwrapped. The KEK and key-wrapping operation is never seen by this SDK.

member.summary: The encrypted content encryption key.

member.summary: Encrypts the given stream and provides the metadata used to encrypt. This method writes to a memory stream, optimized for known-size data that will already be buffered in memory.

Be sure to document exceptions thrown by these methods on your public methods.
